field_edited_text.value:
126 Poromac RivEr BRIDGE

urer, accountant, clerk stenographer, legal and other special services, and
office rental, supplies, and equipment, together with sundry administration
expenses are allowed to be deducted from the total.

7. The traffic report submitted by Coverdale and Colpitts, on September 3,
1938, with a cash one way toll rate of $0.75 per passenger and vehicle, as a
base rate for the tolls, will produce an annual gross revenue of $141,000 per
year, for the average of the first five years of operation, assuming that 1941
will be the first complete year of operation.

8. If all arrangements for financing have been completed on or before
October 15, 1938, the construction of this bridge can be started before
January 1, 1939, and the entire construction can be completed on or before
June 30, 1940, thus meeting the requirements for beginning and ending the
work as established by the Federal Emergency Administration of Public
Works.

9. Finally, this report has established the fact that the entire cost of
the bridge and approaches exclusive of interest during construction and
bond discount is $4,658,000. The estimates of cost, herein presented, are
based on labor rates as they now exist in the Construction Industry, and
which may reasonably be expected to exist during the period of this con-
struction work.
